info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 12:50AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Berks County through 115 AM EDT... At 1250 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Strausstown, or 9 miles northeast of Myerstown, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hamburg, Womelsdorf, Robesonia, Bernville and Strausstown. This includes Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 14 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
